text: is a village located in Shiribeshi, Hokkaido, Japan. As of September 2016, the village has an estimated population of 1,157. The total area is 280.11 km². ==Geography== The center of Akaigawa is in a caldera and surrounded by mountains on every side.Outline of Akaigawa Kiroro Resort is on the eastern of the village.Kiroro Resort *Mountains: Mount Yoichi, Mount Ponkuto *Rivers: Yoichi River, Shiroigawa River, Akaigawa River ===Neighboring cities and towns=== * Minami-ku, Sapporo * Otaru * Yoichi * Niki * Kutchan * Kyōgoku ==History== The name derives from Ainu word "hure-pet", meaning "red river".History of Akaigawa *1899: Akaigawa Village split off from Ōe Village (now Niki Town). *1906: Akaigawa became a Second Class Village. *1991: Kiroro Resort opened. ==Education== * Akaigawa Junior High School * Akaigawa Elementary School * Miyako Elementary School ==References== ==External links== * *Official Website Category:Villages in Hokkaido
